text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the criterion by stating: \"Article 3 \u2013 Meaning of \\\"responsible person\\\" The responsible person is defined as: - (a) The employer, in relation to a workplace under their control - (b) The person who has control of the premises in connection with carrying on a trade, business, or undertaking - (c) The owner, where the person in control of the premises does not have control in connection with a trade, business, or undertaking. This is critical to your case. As the building owner, you are a responsible person under Article 3. However, the neighbouring company, as a leaseholder using the premises for their trade, is also a responsible person.\" This directly and accurately states the definition of the responsible person under Article 3 of the Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 and applies it to the scenario.", "criterion_id": "9b58827b-8cab-4583-8aa8-476d0c2cc5b8"}
